Active transmission, as Justinian remarks, is the rule. Those rights οἱ action only are excepted (of which the actio iniuriarum is here taken as a type) which are grounded not on a damnum or injury to property, but on a grievance or insult to the person, e. g. among others, the querella inofficiosi testamenti, Dig. 5. 2. 6. 2, and the remedy os a patron or pater against a freedman or child who commenced legal proceedings against him without the praetor's permission, Tit.16.3 ins.
